abstract: Public Employees Federation, New York's second-largest union of state workers, strikes last-minute deal with Cuomo administration that must still be approved by members; union hopes to avoid thousands of imminent layoffs; revised contract runs for four years, includes three-year wage freeze and requires members to make higher contributions toward health insurance.
snippet: New York’s second-largest union of state workers, the Public Employees Federation, struck a last-minute deal with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo that must still be approved by members.
lead_paragraph: New York’s second-largest union of state workers, the Public Employees Federation, struck a last-minute deal with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo that must still be approved by members.

headline.main: Union’s Deal With Cuomo May Prevent 3,500 Layoffs
headline.print_headline: Union’s Deal With Cuomo Could Save 3,500 Jobs
headline.seo: Cuomo’s Deal With Public Employees Federation Halts Layoffs
